column2: (adj.) dirty, unclean, foul, filthy; vulgar, low, paltry; vile
(n.) innate quality, nature, temperament, constitution, character
(n.) right, justice, duty, law
(n.) light, brightness
(proper n.) Camilla, warrior and leader of the Volsci
(adv.) at the same time, together, at once, simultaneously
(adj.) equal
(v.) to be on fire, burn, blaze, be burned, glow
(v.) to break (in pieces), dash to pieces, shiver, shatter, fracture
(n.) seashore, seaside, beach
(v.) to sleep, rest; do nothing
(adj.) ugly, unsightly, unseemly, repulsive, foul, filthy; shameful, disgraceful
(n.) an evil, mischief, misfortune, calamity
(adv.) with difficulty, with much ado, hardly, scarcely, barely
(n.) speech; eloquence; the power of speech
(v.) to burn up, destroy; reduce, wear away; extinguish, exhaust; devour, consume; spend, squander
(adj.) alone, only, single, sole
(v.) (with dat.) to believe, trust; to confide in, have confidence in
(prep./adv.) (with acc.) (of space) behind, after; (of time) behind, afterward, after, later
(v.) to uncover, open, disclose; explain, recount; reveal; establish
(prep.) (with abl.) without
(n.) pen, stylus used for writing on wax tablets
(n.) ashes
(v.) to carry, bring
(proper n.) Troy, a city of Asia Minor
(n.) tavern, inn, small shop, booth, hut, cottage
(adv./conj.) not; if not, unless
(n.) walled town, city, city of Rome
(n.) staff, rod, pole; spear, javelin
(adj.) Alexandrian, pertaining to Alexandria (a city in Egypt)
(v.) to kindle, set on fire, inflame
(v.) to twine around, encircle, encompass, embrace
(v.) to shudder (at), stand on end, stand erect, bristle, be rough
(v.) to free; acquit, absolve; liberate, release
(v.) to frighten; deter
(v.) to wish ... not, not to wish; be unwilling, refuse
(n.) hope
(adv.) if, whether; now; surely not? [indicates a question that expects a “no” answer]
(adj.) of oneself, belonging to oneself, his own, her own, his, her, its, their
(n.) practical skill, art
(v.) to choose, select, prefer, wish, wish for, desire
(conj.) and; also, too, besides, likewise, as well, even; both...and (et...et)
(adv.) only, merely
(n.) generation, age, people of any time
(v.) to speak, talk, say, tell, mention, utter
(conj.) or, or whether
(adj.) to the right, on the right side, right
(conj.) but, on the other hand, on the contrary, however
(n.) teacher, tutor, master, expert, chief; pilot of a ship
(v.) to glide, slide, move, fall, slip, float, pass, flow
